name: Jane Patteson
comment info: The most important graph is missing: The Keeling Curve. It tells us how rapidly atmospheric CO2 concentrations are rising, and this tells us what we can expect for future warming.

replies.comment info:
Good morning, @Jane Patteson --

This Feb. 2023 NYT article has the Keeling Curve:https://www.nytimes.com/2023/02/06/climate/mauna-loa-carbon-dioxide-eruption.html.  The data is from the Mauna Loa Observatory after the December 2022 eruption.

name: Cassie Limez
comment info:
I love scientists who create technology to fix world problems. 

Additionally people need to realize that their actions make a difference and an accumulation of small changes is what creates lasting impact. There is no more ignoring and hoping it will go away. It’s not worth the detriment to our world for the  “comfort” we get from deluding ourselves that there is not a crisis happening.

name: Pete Kronowitt
comment info: This is a remarkable piece of work. It will take time to digest these charts and the background. But the message is clear with a first glance, we need to do more than read and understand the issue. We need to get engaged now, elect leaders who will address the climate crisis, join effective grassroots organizations, change our own behavior and talk about the climate crisis.
